page.description: The Alpha Anywhere Enterprise edition provides Xbasic program access to SQL databases such as Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL as well as Microsoft Access. This functionality extends the familiar Alpha Anywhere database features that previously supported only .DBF files. AlphaDAO provides the following SQL objects. Each object has properties and methods.

case.title: SQL::Argument
case.description: This object defines a single argument to be passed to a SQL function in a SQL::Arguments collection.

case.title: SQL::Arguments
case.description: A collection of arguments to be passed to a SQL function.

case.title: SQL::CallResult
case.description: This object provides a more complete description of a function call on an object in the SQL name space.

case.title: SQL::Connection
case.description: Each instance of SQL::Connection represents a potential or active database session.

case.title: SQL::DataTypeInfo
case.description: A single column in a table or result set. The description includes the name, size, precision, Alpha Anywhere type, the native type, and an intermediate type (see SQL::IntermediateType ) which contains more precise type information. This intermediate type makes it possible to recreate a table using the closest possible matching type in the target table.

case.title: SQL::IndexColumnInfo
case.description:
A description of one of the columns in an index.
A SQL::IndexInfo contains one or more columns that make up the primary key, the foreign key, of a unique or non-unique index.

case.title: SQL::IndexInfo
case.description: A description of an index on a SQL table. Each table in a SQL database has one or more relationships, constraints or indexes. The primary key, foreign keys, and unique and non-unique indexes are each described by a SQL::IndexInfo instance. The SQL::TableInfo object contains a list of those indexes.

case.title: SQL::ResultSet
case.description: A collection of rows returned from the execution of a query. When a SQL query returns one or more rows of data, you can use the SQL::ResultSet object to get the description of the result set and to navigate within the rows of the results to retrieve the data.

case.title: SQL::Row
case.description: The data returned by the SQL::ResultSet.NextRow() method.

case.title: SQL::Schema
case.description: A collection of SQL table definitions. SQL::Schema is a container for one or more SQL::TableInfo objects.

case.title: SQL::TableInfo
case.description: A fairly complete description of a SQL table, its columns, and its indexes. Many of the SQL functions either ask you to provide a SQL::TableInfo object, or will create one for you. Using this object, it is possible to retrieve a description of a table from one database and construct a copy of that table in the same or another database.
